Description: A pottery mortarium, or shallow grinding-bowl, made from grey-green marl clay, perhaps an import from the Levant. The vessel has a flat base and an external rim. Part of one side is missing.
Bibliographic references: Leclère and Spencer 2014 / Tell Dafana Reconsidered: The Archaeology of an Egyptian Frontier Town (p.92, p.100, p.189, pl.31)
